oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Looking east down Union Street from 5th Avenue
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph shows many of the stores in downtown Nashville on Union and 5th Avenue. It also shows cars and pedestrians crowding the city streets.

During the 1920s, many people came to downtown business areas such as Nashville to shop at stores and purchase the items that they needed. With the development of automobiles and better roads to travel, many young people from rural areas came to visit the cities to shop and experience the urban life.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Stores; Business Districts; Shopping
Photographs
